reviews.review_msg: Terrible prof. The worst language skills I have ever seen among all the profs.
Exams are tough. The average was 29%, but he added 10% to all students so it's 39%.  Have to listen very carefully due to his accent.
very helpful prof, but writes super long exams. lectures are very useful so pay attention. marking scheme is fair.

This is disaster, you literally studying nothing and then solving some random stuff, and when you are attending office hours, you will get answers like it is better to revise this chapter, as if i didnt read and revised it. Do not take her, seriously, the grade system is a disaster

Kristin is the best professor I've ever known. She is definitely my favourite. I would love to take more courses with her. Her explanations for the graphs are the best . To be honest, I used to hate doing calculation questions but she made them so easy to understand, I just fell in love with doing numericals. She's just awesome.
definitely a gpa booster.

She is a really nice person but better off as a counsellor than a teacher, tries her best but rather not engaging at all in lectures,makes mistakes while teaching which might misguide you for the midterms. Do not take this course for a GPA booster, she will grade you very strict and get ready for graphs.

I absolutely loved her notes. they were fill in the blanks which were easy to follow and made us pay attention in class. (i usually hate copying long notes from lectures... but fill in the blanks were more engaging imo). Her exams were actually pretty easy if you follow her notes (the examples are in the notes are similar to her exams).

Lecture was 3 hours of listening to her read directly off the slides which were fill in the blank and she doesn't post them after so you have to attend every lecture just to write a few words. At the end of every class you get to waste an hour watching her do a participation quiz that you copy and hand in for attendance.
Gpa booster confirmed. Studied only  2 days for each test and got an A

She is a sweetheart! She is always super available, and replies e-mails relatively quickly. Her class is structured nicely. There is a lot of material to cover, so beware. But if you keep up with the notes & assignments, you should be well-prepared. Her MC are definitely tricky, but written is straight-forward. A great semester!
I got a C in her class, but I still think she is an excellent professor!I like her teaching style.
Honestly an amazing prof. Incredibly nice, and smart. There's no reason you shouldn't get it least an A- in this class, not 1 complaint about her
It's an easy course to ace if you're literate in maths and graphs. Study her notes and redo her assignments and snatch that A+!
Nice prof, so sweet and helpful, perfect
Course itself, probably easier amongst the 200 level ones. Otherwise, she's really nice, approachable and wears a lot of green for an environmental econ class(:
She's good
She is nice and hot, her final is not too hard, but her F range is so big (2 times of A range), and the avg. dont very high (58% in MT) watch out!!!!
The course is too easy. And she is so hot! Never feel bored in class.
Great prof, very organized. Easy assignment and her notes are all you need. If you study her notes, you can do good in midterm and final. Highly recommend.

Nice teacher. This course is really hard. The class average for the midterm was 58%. She scaled the the class so everyone can do well. Her notes are original. She is clear in lectures and helpful during office hours. Must work hard on assignments and final is everything.   Give the full three hours for the final.
a fairly easy course...easy assignments, midterms and finals...just look at the notes and ur be finee...da text sux...dont even need to buy it! A easy marker...and she looks pritti gdd..!!
easy class. mt and final were fair. nice prof. notes were organized and easy to understand. recommended.

Just finished the final today. She didn't give us ANY MT questions neither in midterm nor in final. But all written questions on both exams were EASY if you actually studied HER NOTE. DONT EVEN BOTHER TO BUY THE TEXT IT WAS THE WORST TEXT I EVER SEEN! Thanks to Kristin, her notes are very clear, easy to follow, and also easy to understand.
Easy class. just read her notes, dont even bother buying the textbook cuz u r NOT gonna read it. Her practice final exam questions are the same as those REAL FINAL exam questions ^_^...SWEET!!

seems like her first time teaching so shes pretty unorganized. emails the lecture notes to the class late the night before lecture. assignments are emailed to the class pretty late too. a class website would be VERY helpful to get the lecture notes and assignments. very clear and is teaching a really easy subject luckily. and quite good looking.
No Comments
He and TA are horrible joke. Do not take this course.
Fantastic lecturer. Rather than taking notes, sit back and just follow along with lecture. It's better to focus on comprehension rather than memorizing in this class.

Lectures are very conversational and entertaining. Applies concepts anecdotally in a way that makes them easy to understand. He doesn't prepare lecture slides however and there is sometimes a bit of a disconnect between what is covered in lectures and what is asked in tutorials, projects and exams. Projects/Assignments were fun nonetheless.

didn't respond to student emails within a reasonable deadline usually responded like 2-3 weeks after initial mail. lectures weren't focused on materials tested or examined. use a lot of the same examples and didn't provide adequate and clear direction on course concepts. quizzes weren't realized on time . he repeats a lot of past questions.

By far the most horrific prof in all of sfu. His exams are so time crunched that you cant even blink, test questions do not match anything he teaches during lectures nor the slides. The quiz questions are a bunch gathered from external websites like chegg, course hero and quizlet. He is on vacation and does not answer emails. rip gpa

Massive disconnect between lectures/textbook and what's actually on the test. Almost no communication from the prof, you basically have no idea if what you're doing is right or wrong because there are no practice questions given in this calculations heavy class. Assignments are a joke and it feels like this course reuses material from other classes

In a few words: This guy is a joke like literally. I don't know what is the problem here. Is he not able to cope up with the whole online scene or is he just like this normally? One hilarious thing my emails (like none) are still not answered to date and the semester is ending soon.

I usually read these to get a slight understanding of a prof, but in this case I am going out of my way to make sure you do not take this course, as long as its online. Horrible communicator, Disconnect between TA's and Prof, Doesn't test on what is taught. Has had numerous meetings with Head of Econ to improve his teaching style yet little changes

Super disorganized. Syllabus makes 0 sense. Tests on things not covered in lectures or textbook. Lectures don't follow textbooks at all and aren't even useful. Self teach yourself everything including the syllabus. Office hours are 2 hrs a week where he answers emails same with TA's. No TA prof communication. Econ 260 is a cool course horrid prof

This prof does not support your learning. He never answers emails, the syllabus is a mess, his instructions are unclear. You have these assignments that you are not taught how to do and then you get poor marks on it from the TA so your grade tanks. The Ta is also not helpful. Don't take.

He never answers your email and does not follow syllabus. His quiz has some questions that were not covered during recorded lectures nor the book. Essentially you have to pray (if you are religious) or just lie and try not to cry in order to answer those questions. Save yourselves don't take his class.

The prof is like he is on vacation. he doesn't respond to any emails. terrible prof. No clear instructions. the sudden change to the course syllabus while posting video lectures a few hours before the deadline of the assignments. Avoid him.

Due to COVID-19, this course was online. There was no new syllabus for our class, instead the previous semester syllabus was used and not followed. Success in this course depends on clear communication and feedback, both components were lacking to the determent of my learning.

If you like to be ignored then you must take this class! This prof does not like to reply to emails - ESPECIALLY those that require him to respond with in-depth replies. He loves tight deadlines and giving out confusing instructions. Make some friends in this class cus your friends and you probably know more about this subject than him.

This was an online course due to COVID-19. He provided little information about quizzes and assignments, never gave an update on the course through announcements or emails. He would occasionally send an email a couple of days before to say there is a quiz the next day. Course materials were disorganized and spread between three separate websites.

HORRIBLE lectures, so boring you snore for 3 straight hours. EXTREMELY disorganized and undedicated. Needs to revamp lecture style, canvas and website. Cannot explain on a 200 lvl, explains on a 400 lvl--ununderstandable. Just absolutely NOT interested in teaching, and therefore really shouldn't be. Extremely lazy.
Anyone else here cause they just found his final exam ridiculously difficult?

It is not a hard course but he makes this course hard and complicated. Never reply to emails. TA were also useless. Assignments were hard but does not explain much about it. But, still have to attend class and tutorial.

Attending classes is a must. All materials covered in class are used in assignments,text questions, and exams. He might be a little quick in lecture so it's best to study off textbook questions. His exams are VERY fair.  Final even had an exact same question from assignment.  Not an easy course though so work hard!

An embarrassment to the profession of professors. The quality of his teaching can only be comparable to that highschool teacher that you hated because he has all these strict rules, lack of availability, obsolete teaching methods and limited additional materials for further reference. Honestly, stay away from him. He is THAT bad.
Does not reply to emails ever! Give you questions on assignments that he didn't even cover in class. Talks nothing about midterm or final when they are approaching.

he has a tendency to stop the whole lecture every single time a late student comes in and just stares at them for about 5 seconds.. weird prof.. no help at all with the course material when asking for help and looks like troll.
OK professor. Exams are fairly easy and he scales the class. Seems to be very knowledgably about the subject which causes him to go off tangent. Read the book to study for the exams, not his notes.
OK Prof, knows his stuff, fairly helpful, long lectures with examples. Fair exams and marking. Pretty average course and prof. Does tend to wander in lectures though.

Material and lectures were interesting. The midterm and finals were very easy as long as you read the text. His lectures provide you with the basics, so reading the text is important(don't worry, chapters are short). Definitely recommended if econ is your thing

The material is very easy. The assignments were VERY similar to examples in class and in questions from the textbook. Helpful during office hours, talks alot and might tangent a little, but sometimes basically gives you the answers (term assignment). Midterm and final were very fair.
He is making interesting materials bored, straight-forward stuffs hard. He added sth in additional to the textbook, Compensating Variation? CYEV?

he's easy if u catch his way of teaching &exam Qs. Assignments &exams are meant to be easy BUT the wording of the Qs make 'em alot more complicated +very confusing. He's very unorganized. He's good at the topic but not good at teaching it. so u really gotta reach "CATCH HIM" if u wanna do good
I agree with the laziness, always late!  For a course that sounds so interesting he does a great job of making it boring.  Otherwise tests and for the most part assignments are pretty easy.
It seems like that he never forgive students, no late assignment is acceptable even if you are late about 0.000000001 second. IT IS LATE. The worst teacher I have ever seen.
Great teacher!!
Not very helpful or clear. Very smart and relevant however. If you learn better on your own with high textbook use go for it! If not.... :/
In my opinion poor at getting key terms across while lecturing. Slides are full of content but hardly chooses anything from slides demands high textbook use. I don't recommend MR. Harder

This professor is useless! he doesnt know how to teach nor does he know how to communicate effectively with his students! He has a VERY bad attitude and i want to warn this guy that if he keeps up with this kind of attitude towards his students, he WILL lose his job, its a matter of time! Exams were brutal, save ur money AND your GPA!
not helpful at all and very sarcastic to his students with a bad attitude. marks hard and thinks his jokes are funny when they arnt. BAD

He is an okay prof. His exams are mainly based on math problems done in tutorials, so as long as you practice with them you are fine. But he gave one question on our mt that he hadn't gone over in lecture. and that question is 10% of the mt. And after the TA went over the answer, i had no idea what she was talking about

He has his office hour everyday, but I guess it is his temper that keeps students away from asking him (at least, I cant stand his temper myself). I want him to know that asking questions does not mean we want trouble, nor we are not hard working. If we can understand everything by just reading, what do we need u for? In short, u r not the worst.
Bad.

umm...his exams are not too hard, but you do really have to read the questions very carefully, because you might even get confused with a very simple question. The notes are a bit too brief. In the exam, there is always mc questions with true, false, and uncertain. It takes you a lot of time to think in that part...sometimes.

Environmental Econ - yes he over do it when explaining concepts with his jokes and emphasis. Assignments are not too difficult but needs you to fully understand the material to do it. Sometimes overly arrogant/bias when replying to questions. I was failing going into the final. But got B- at the end(final). But I wouldn't take a course w/ him again

His characters swings between over-the-top to bumbling idiot. Doesn't really know what he is teaching; lots of forced dramatic emphasis and desperately unbearable jokes. Questions asked in assignments, quizzes, even the midterm are unfair -- requires unnecessary and unasked for calculations to "fully" answer simpler questions.

had his first lecture yesterday. i found him pretty exaggerating, and biased. Well, he ended up embarassing himself when a girl ask him to explain why&how human breathing is polluting air. he pushes too hard on the students, and tries to hard to get ppl to agree with him. i m disappointed. he totally needs to work on lecturing skills.
He is the BEST Econ Prof! The only prof who is willing to spend that extra effort to help you out before the exam.
he sucks at teachin..can't read his notes..

his in-class notes are great, plus read the textbook that correspond.. he focuses more on qualitative stuff.. not quantitative mathematical questions..  too bad for ESL students.. but yea he's lazy ;)
No Comments

pretty decent prof! His midterm was brutal... it was something like 9/120 students got an A and 50 something failed but then his final made it up.  I like his accent and his fashion sense .. . Overall, just study his notes cuz some of his questions are DIRECTLY from it.

Lectures were boring, lots of notes taking but you'll have a hard time understanding his handwriting. His exam format is: 60% REALLY EASY question, then just bomb the whole class with one question. It would be better if it goes on a curve though, since everyone bombs that question.

His accent makes it hard to understand him but I don't doubt his knowledge of the material. His midterm was fair and so was the take home final. Attendance of lecture is not that mandatory since I didn't go for 4 straight weeks and still managed a B+. This is due to the fact that the lectures are out of the textbook.

Barkin is an amazing prof if you actually care about learning. If you want an easy grade then don't take economics. She is very passionate about teaching the RIGHT way as she won't take half-thought-out answers. If you engage in lecture you will have success. After failing the first midterm from lack of effort, I begin to engage myself and flourish

Good prof, explains concepts clearly and circles back to real-world examples that engage the class. Sets students up for success by giving practice exams with solutions, I highly recommend taking econ 260 with Mike.
Great prof
Very nice guy, tries to make jokes now and then. Plenty of practice questions.
Great prof who tried his best to make lectures interesting with empirical examples. Can go a little quick at times, but go to lecture and do his practice exams a bunch of times and you will be fine.
